info.title: Trexity API
info.description:
# Migrating to v2

This version of the API is a major departure from v1. We normalize around the concept of a shipment
and provide a more consistent API. All endpoints are now shipment centric, and all webhook events
are relative to a shipment.

**Breaking Changes**

- the concepts of a "shipment" and a "parcel" have been merged together into a [shipment](#tag/Shipments)
- shipment IDs from v1 that were created from the "Create a shipment" endpoint will work when performing shipment read operations in v2, but the shipment ID returned will be different
- parcel IDs from v1 will work as-is for shipment IDs in v2 with no exceptions
- the complex rate endpoints have been replaced with a new set of [batching endpoints](#tag/Batching) that will perform the same tasks
- [addressing](#tag/Addresses) has been changed from a single address string with a format, to a structured [address object](#tag/Addresses)
- the following webhook events have been replaced:
  - `parcel.picked_up` with `shipment.picked_up`
  - `parcel.delivered` with `shipment.delivered`
  - `parcel.returning` with `shipment.returning`
  - `parcel.returned` with `shipment.returned`
  - `shipment.driver.accepted` with `shipment.courier.accepted`
  - `shipment.driver.arrived_at_pickup` with `shipment.courier.arrived_at_pickup`
  - `shipment.driver.arrived_at_delivery` with `shipment.courier.arrived_at_delivery`
  - `shipment.driver.renounced` with `shipment.courier.renounced`
- the following webhook events have been removed:
  - `shipment.completed` use `shipment.delivered` or `shipment.undeliverable` instead
  - `shipment.driver.parcel_delivered` use `shipment.delivered` instead
  - `shipment.driver.picked_up` use `shipment.picked_up` instead
  - `shipment.posted` use `shipment.courier.accepted` instead

**Updates**

- a new endpiont has been added to retrieve your [webhook secret](/#operation/getWebhookSecretKey)

# Issues

Please open [bug reports](https://github.com/trexitycode/openapi/issues/new?template=bug_report.md) or [feature requests](https://github.com/trexitycode/openapi/issues/new?template=feature_request.md) in the [issues](https://github.com/trexitycode/openapi/issues) board.

# Usage Policy

By using this API to provide shipment rates to your customers you agree to display the [Rate](#operation/getSimpleRate) `name` without modification.
The [Rate](#operation/getSimpleRate) `description` can be replaced with a custom value (e.g. Same-day, etc.) or displayed as-is from the Rate.

This allows Trexity to ensure consistent messaging wherever Trexity shipment rates are displayed to your customers.

## Suspension & Termination

Failure to comply with this Usage Policy may result in suspension of your Trexity merchant account and/or API Keys. Continued failure to comply may result in the termination of your Trexity merchant account.

# Concepts & Workflows

## Concepts

**Shipment** represents an order, has pickup information and customer information.

**Rate** represents a price for completing a shipment.

## Workflow

1. [Calculate a shipment rate](#operation/calculateShipmentRates) by specifying pickup information, customer information and the delivery address to get a rate to show your customer and obtain an estimate for a pickup time
2. [Create a shipment](#operation/createShipment) by specifying pickup information, customer information and the delivery address
3. [Get shipment label](#operation/getShipmentLabel) for a shipment then affix to the shipment packaging
4. [Listen for shipment events](#tag/Webhooks) to track the shipment until it is delivered

## Sandbox Environment

All API operations have an alternate base URL available in the sandbox environment.

To use the sandbox environment:
1. Create an account on the [Sandbox Merchant Portal](https://merchant.beta.trexity.com/signup)
2. Navigate to the [API Keys page](https://merchant.beta.trexity.com/api/keys) in the Advanced area.
3. Create a new API Key
4. Use the new API Key and the sandbox base URL in your API requests

> Use the dropdown in the top right of an API operation page to select the sandbox environment server.

### Credit Cards

When signing up for the sandbox environment you can use the  following
credit card with any 3-digit CVC and a future expiration date.

```
4000 0012 4000 0000
```

### Expectations

The sandbox environment is intended for development and testing purposes only.
Expect latency to be higher than the production environment.

We use our sandbox environment as well when developing new features to ensure
there are no breaking changes. So expect the occasional breaking change when
using the sandbox environment.

# Responses

### Successful Responses

All endpoints, when responding successfully, will return a JSON object with a `data` field when there is data to return.
```
// typescript interface
interface SuccessResponse<T = object | any[]> {
  data: T
}
```

### Error Responses

All endpoints, when applicable and responding with a non 200 HTTP status code, will return a JSON object with an `errors` field.
```
// typescript interface
interface ErrorResponse {
  errors: { message: string, code: string }[]
}
```

tags.name: Addresses
tags.description:
Group of endpoints for handling addresses.

### Address Format

In general, whenever an endpoint accepts an address, we expect the following shape:

```
{
  "addressLine1": "123 Fake St",
  "addressLine2": "Apt 4",
  "city": "Ottawa",
  "provinceCode": "ON",
  "postalCode": "K2G 8FT",
  "countryCode": "CA"
}
```

## Apartment / Unit / Suite

To specify an apartment, unit or suite as part of the address use the address line 2 field.
```
{
  "addressLine1": "123 Fake St",
  "addressLine2": "Apt 4",
  "city": "Ottawa",
  "provinceCode": "ON",
  "postalCode": "K2G 8FT",
  "countryCode": "CA"
}
```

tags.name: Rating
tags.description:
Prior to creating a Shipment, you can calculate the rates based on the pickup and delivery addresses.
See our [rates](/#operation/getRate) endpoint for more information.

tags.name: Shipments
tags.description: A shipment is a central concept in the API. It contains a pickup address, delivery address with customer information, and represents a shipment that will be completed by a courier.

tags.name: Batching
tags.description: Batching is the process of optimizing a large set of deliveries from the same pickup location into efficient batches.

tags.name: Custom Labels
tags.description:
All shipments come with a label that must be downloaded and affixed to the shipment packaging. To specify a custom label for your shipment do the following:

1. Create a shipment with the `externalId` and `scanId` values specified in the request body
2. Ensure that the `scanId` value is encoded as a QR code or 1D barcode on your label
3. Affix your label to the shipment packaging before a courier picks it up

We always recommend providing us a sample label to test with to confirm that the label is scanable by our Courier App.

> **Note:** If a custom label is specified, it is your responsibility to ensure that the label is affixed to the shipment packaging before a courier picks it up. Additionally, you will not be able to download a label from the Trexity API or your Trexity portal.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
Manage webhooks.

## Verifying Requests

All webhook requests have a header that contains a signature signed with the Trexity Merchant's
webhook secret as found in their "Trexity API" settings. Optionally, there is a [getSecretKey](#operation/getWebhookSecretKey) endpoint to retrieve the webhook secret programatically.
To verify the signature, take the raw request body as text and create a SHA256 HMAC signed with the merchant's webhook secret and convert to hex.

Example:
```
// nodejs
const text = await new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
  const buff = []
  req.setEncoding('utf8')
  req.on('data', chunk => (buff.push(chunk)))
  req.once('end', resolve(buff.join('')))
  req.once('error', reject)
})

const sig = require('crypto')
  .createHmac('sha256', process.env.TRX_MERCH_WEBHOOK_SECRET)
  .update(text)
  .digest('hex')

const isValid = req.headers['x-trexity-signature'] === sig

if (!isValid) {
  res.statusCode = 403
  res.end('Forbidden', 'utf8')
  return
}

const body = JSON.parse(body)
// ...
```

## Request Payload

All webhook requests will have the following headers:

- `x-trexity-event-name` the event name
- `x-trexity-signature` the SHA256 HMAC signature of the request
- `x-trexity-webhook-order-id` the processing order of the webhook used to determine what order webhooks should be processed in

All webhook requests will have the following payload shape. Where `data` is the shipment object changed,
like returned from the [get shipment endpoint](#tag/Shipments/operation/getShipment)

```
{
  "timestamp": "2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z",
  "data": {
    ...the shipment object that changed...
  }
}
```

tags.name: Regions
tags.description: Region related operations that usually involve service cities and their zones

x-codeSamples.label: cURL

post.description:
Checks whether an address is serviceable and returns a result that identifies if the address can be
used as a delivery address or a pickup address. If, a pickup address is provided, the result will
indicate if the delivery address is in a tiered zone.

### Rate Limiting

This operation can be requested without authentication, however it will have a
strict rate limit of 3 requests every 10 seconds.

However, authenticated requests can request 12 times every 10 seconds.

**Unexhaustive list of error codes.**

- `invalid-delivery.addressLine1` = When the addressLine1 is missing
- `invalid-delivery.city` = When the city is missing
- `invalid-delivery.postalCode` = When the postalCode is missing, invalid or not acceptedable
- `invalid-delivery.provinceCode` = When the province is missing, or is not acceptedable
- `invalid-delivery.countryCode` = When the country is missing, or is not acceptedable
- `invalid-pickup.addressLine1` = When the addressLine1 is missing
- `invalid-pickup.city` = When the city is missing
- `invalid-pickup.postalCode` = When the postalCode is missing, invalid or not acceptedable
- `invalid-pickup.provinceCode` = When the province is missing, or is not acceptedable
- `invalid-pickup.countryCode` = When the country is missing, or is not acceptedable
- `unverified-delivery-address` = When the delivery address cannot be verified with a geocoded location
- `unverified-pickup-address` = When the pickup address cannot be verified with a geocoded location

pickup.description: The pickup address from which to generate the tiered zones.
If `true` then the address can be used as a pickup address (or business address).

delivery.description:
The delivery classification of the address.

`none` = The address is outside a known delivery zone and is unserviceable.

`normal` = The address is serviceable and normal delivery rates apply.

`extended` = The address is serviceable and surcharges may apply.

`tier-1, tier-2, tier-3, ...` = The address is serviceable and the address is in a tier-1, tier-2, tier-3, etc. zone.

lngLat.description: The latitude and logitude of the checked address.

serviceCity.description: Service city that the address is located. Provided in the format: "(city name), (2 letter abbreviation of province)" (may or may not be supported by Trexity)

x-codeSamples.label: cURL

post.description:
Calculate the rates available for a shipment.

If no `pickupAddress` is specified then your primary location's address will
be used as the pickup address.

Please review our [Usage Policy](/#section/Usage-Policy) before displaying rates to your customers.

The rate response will include estimates for post, pickup, and delivery time.

Additionally, the properties `pickupAfter`, `deliverAfter` and `deliverBefore` can be provided to indicate a
pickup or delivery window. Otheriwse the next available pickup window (i.e. ASAP) is assumed.

**Unexhaustive list of error codes.**

- `invalid-merchant-requirements` = When the requirements specified don't match the requirements granted to the merchant
- `pickup-address-unserviceable` = When the pickup address cannot be matched to any of the merchant's locations
- `invalid-pickup-address` = When the pickup address is invalid
- `pickup-point-outside-zone` = When the pickup address is outside Trexity's service area
- `invalid-data-payload` = When there are issues with the input data provided
- `num-labels-too-large` = When numLabels is too large
- `time-constraint-violation` = When the delivery/pickup time constraints specified cannot be met
- `service-unavailable` = When API Service Availability Rules in merchant portal prevent rates from being returned
- `time-constraint-violation` = When the constraint specified by pickupAfter, or deliverAfter and/or deliverBefore cannot be met
- `post-date-outside-operating-hours` = When the estimated post date is outside Trexity's or the merchant's operating hours
- `delivery-date-outside-operating-hours` = When the estimated delivery date is outside Trexity's or the merchant's operating hours
- `pickup-address-outsidetaxboundary` = When the pickup address is outside the province/state of the merchant's location
- `merchant-disabled` = When the merchant account has been disabled
- `missing-profile-details` = When the merchant profile is incomplete
- `delivery-point-outside-zone` = When the delivery address is outside Trexity's service area
- `pickup-point-outside-zone` = When the pickup address is outside Trexity's service area

get.description:
Get the region for a specific pickup address.

### Rate Limiting

This operation can be requested without authentication, however it will have a
strict rate limit of 6 requests every 10 seconds.

However, authenticated requests can request 12 times every 10 seconds.

**Possible error codes:**
- `invalid-address` = When the address cannot be recognized as a valid address
- `invalid-addressLine1` = When the addressLine1 is missing
- `invalid-city` = When the city is missing
- `invalid-postalCode` = When the postalCode is missing, invalid or not acceptedable
- `invalid-provinceCode` = When the province is missing, or is not acceptedable
- `invalid-countryCode` = When the country is missing, or is not acceptedable

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The pickup address from which to generate the market zones.

parameters.name: postalCode
parameters.description: The pickup address from which to generate the market zones.

parameters.name: provinceCode
parameters.description: The pickup address from which to generate the market zones.

parameters.name: countryCode
parameters.description: The pickup address from which to generate the market zones.

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X POST "https://trexity.app/api/v2/shipments" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -d '{
    "externalId": "order-12345",
    "deliveryAddress": {
      "addressLine1": "456 Delivery St",
      "city": "Ottawa",
      "provinceCode": "ON",
      "postalCode": "K1A 0A6", 
      "countryCode": "CA"
    },
    "pickupAddress": {
      "addressLine1": "123 Pickup Ave",
      "city": "Ottawa",
      "provinceCode": "ON",
      "postalCode": "K2G 6F2",
      "countryCode": "CA"
    },
    "deliveryName": "John Doe",
    "deliveryEmail": "john.doe@example.com",
    "deliveryPhone": "+1-613-555-0123",
    "numLabels": 1
  }'

post.description:
Create a shipment and optionally schedule it for pickup. A rate for the shipment will be calculated at the same time.

If you want to schedule for pickup use `pickupStartAt` and ensure it matches your market's pickup windows as listed [here](https://trexity.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/16940024932627-Trexity-Pickup-Windows).

If no `pickupAddress` is specified then your primary location's address will be used as the pickup address.

**Unexhaustive list of error codes.**

- `unauthorized-requirements` = When the requirements specified don't match the requirements granted to the merchant
- `pickup-address-unserviceable` = When the pickup address cannot be matched to any of the merchant's locations
- `invalid-pickup-address` = When the pickup address is invalid
- `invalid-delivery-address` = When the delivery address is invalid
- `pickup-point-outside-zone` = When the pickup address is outside Trexity's service area
- `invalid-input` = When there are issues with the input data provided
- `invalid-delivery-data` = When there are issues with the data provided and the delivery cannot be created
- `num-labels-too-large` = When numLabels is too large
- `invalid-scanids` = When the scanId specified is already in use
- `outside-operating-hours` = When the pickup or delivery time specified is outside the your delivery hours or Trexity's service hours
- `invalid-scheduled-posting-date` = The scheduling fields are invalid and do not describe a valid pickup window
- `unauthorized-numlabels` = When total numLabels for the delivery is too large
- `pickup-address-outsidetaxboundary` = The pickup address is outside the merchant's location province
- `merchant-disabled` = The merchant has been disabled
- `missing-profile-details` = The merchant has an incomplete profile
- `no-shipment-rate` = A delivery rate failed to be calculated due to delivery or pickup address geofencing error

get.description:
List shipments that match the specified filters.

## Filtering By Dates

When filtering by a date range both the `fromDate` and `toDate` query parameters must be provided. **The maximum date range is 90 days.**

## Mutually exclusive filters

The following filters are mutually exclusive:
  - `fromDate` and `toDate`
  - `externalId`
  - `metaField1`, `metaField2`, `metaField3`

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
The comma-separated list of fields to include in the shipment response (if not specified or blank then all fields will be included).

If a field is specified that is not defined by the Shipment object, then responds with HTTP 400. Only top-level fields are supported.

schema.description: The ID of the external entity that is associated to this shipment (e.g. the external order or shipment ID).
Can be a partial string to match the value of the first metadata field
Can be a partial string to match the value of the second metadata field
Can be a partial string to match the value of the third metadata field

delete.description: Attempt to delete shipment with `draft` status.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the shipment to delete

x-codeSamples.label: cURL
x-codeSamples.source:
curl -X PATCH "https://trexity.app/api/v2/shipments/{SHIPMENT_ID}" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY" \
  -d '{
    "deliveryName": "Jane Doe",
    "deliveryPhone": "+1-613-555-0124"
  }'

patch.description:
Updates the details of a shipment.

**Unexhaustive list of error codes.**

- `unauthorized-requirements` = When the requirements specified don't match the requirements granted to the merchant
- `pickup-address-unserviceable` = When the pickup address cannot be matched to any of the merchant's locations
- `invalid-pickup-address` = When the pickup address is invalid
- `invalid-delivery-address` = When the delivery address is invalid
- `pickup-point-outside-zone` = When the pickup address is outside Trexity's service area
- `invalid-input` = When there are issues with the input data provided
- `invalid-delivery-data` = When there are issues with the data provided and the delivery cannot be updated
- `num-labels-too-large` = When numLabels is too large
- `invalid-scanids` = When the scanId specified is already in use
- `outside-operating-hours` = When the pickup or delivery time specified is outside the your delivery hours or Trexity's service hours
- `invalid-scheduled-posting-date` = The scheduling fields are invalid and do not describe a valid pickup window
- `unauthorized-numlabels` = When total numLabels for the entire delivery is too large
- `pickup-address-outsidetaxboundary` = The pickup address is outside the merchant's location province
- `merchant-disabled` = The merchant has been disabled
- `missing-profile-details` = The merchant has an incomplete profile
- `no-shipment-rate` = A delivery rate failed to be calculated due to delivery or pickup address geofencing error

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the shipment that needs to be updated

requestBody.description: Payload describing the changes that need to be updated in your shipment

get.description: Gets the details of a shipment

parameters.name: select
parameters.description:
The comma-separated list of fields to include in the delivery response (if not specified or blank then all fields will be included).

If a field is specified that is not defined by the Delivery object, then responds with HTTP 400. Only top-level fields are supported.

post.description:
Marks a shipment as ready for pickup. A shipment marked as ready for pickup will be dispatched to the first available courier. 

Can only mark shipments with the service type `direct` that are in the `draft` status as ready for pickup.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the shipment that needs to be marked as ready for pickup

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the delivery (can be externalId or delivery ID)

schema.description: A label that needs to be scanned at pickup by a Trexity courier.
A label that needs to be scanned at pickup by a Trexity courier.

JSONL text where each line represents a label encoded as a JSON object. Up to "numLabels" (from the delivery) labels are returned.

Each label is an encoded JSON object with the following fields:

- `label`: The label as a base64 encoded string with PNG format.
- `mimeType`: The MIME type of the label. Default is `image/png`.

**NOTE:** The example shows the response as a JSON encoded string, but in practice
the response is actually JSON encoded objects separated by newline characters. This is
a limitation of our OpenAPI renderer.

See: https://jsonlines.org/

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the delivery (can be externalId or delivery ID)

get.description:
Get a shipment's proof of delivery photo or signature.

If the shipment `requirements.proofOfDelivery` is not `photo+signature` or `signature` then a 404 will be returned.

If the shipment is not yet completed or not found then a 404 will be returned.

**Possible error codes.**

- `invalid-delivery-id` - The delivery id is invalid.
- `delivery-not-found` - The delivery is not found.
- `no-proof-of-delivery` - The delivery does not require a proof of delivery.
- `delivery-not-completed` - The delivery is not yet completed.

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the delivery (can be externalId or delivery ID)

get.description: Get the tracking URL for a shipment

parameters.name: lifetime
parameters.description: The lifetime of the tracking URL in seconds. Default is 24 hours and maximum is 31 days. After the lifetime passes, the tracking page will respond with 404.

post.description:
Cancels a shipment. A cancelled shipment will no longer be able to be assigned to a courier. 

Can only cancel shipments that are in the `draft`, `pending`, `assigned`, or `in-transit` status.

**If cancelling a delivery while `assigned` or `in-transit` then a cancellation fee will be charged.**

parameters.name: shipmentId
parameters.description: The id of the delivery that needs to be cancelled

x-codeSamples.label: cURL

post.description:
Create a batching operation that optimizes a large set of deliveries from the same pickup location into efficient route plans.

### Pickup location and pickup window
A thing to note is that shipments provided to a batching operation must all have the **same pickup location**, and **cannot have a pickup window specified**.
To schedule for a pickup window, you can update any shipment that was created after a [Create "create shipments" operation](#operation/createBatchingCreateShipmentsOperation) has completed. This will set the pickup window for all shipments created from a batching operation.

**All order IDs must be unique.**
Create shipments from a batching optimization. This will create shipments for each batch in the batching optimization.

Create a new webhook for the specified event.

If a webhook with the same event name and url already exists, a 400 error will be returned.

url.description: Secure (https://...) URL to send the webhook request to.

get.description: List all registered webhooks or registered webhooks for an event.

204.description: Successfully deleted a webhook or if the webhook ID does not exist.

get.description: Get the secret key for the webhook signature verification.
List all your locations. In order to manage Locations, you need to use the [Merchant Portal](https://merchant.trexity.com/).

x-codeSamples.label: cURL

post.description:
Find a location by name or address.

**One of name or address or both must be provided.**

If both are provided, the name will be used to filter the results.

**Possible error codes:**
- `missing-required-fields` = When both name and address are not provided
- `invalid-addressLine1` = When the addressLine1 is missing
- `invalid-city` = When the city is missing
- `invalid-provinceCode` = When the province is missing, or is not acceptedable
- `invalid-postalCode` = When the postalCode is missing, invalid or not acceptedable
- `invalid-countryCode` = When the country is not acceptedable
- `invalid-address` = When the address cannot be recognized as a valid address

oneOf.description: Find a location by address and name

get.description:
Retrieve the receipts for all or one location for a particular calendar month

**Possible error codes:**
- `invalid-year` = When the yearMonth has an invalid year
- `invalid-month` = When the yearMonth has an invalid month

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: The merchant location ID or case insensitive name. If specified then all receipt items will only be for this lcoation.

schema.description: The receipt items rendered as CSV
The receipt items rendered as a standalone HTML
The receipt items rendered as a PDF

MerchantApiKeyAuth.description:
This authentication strategy uses a Trexity Merchant API KEY. This API KEY is used
with the bearer scheme in the Authorization header.

In order to obtain a Trexity Merchant API key, you need to sign-up as Merchant at https://merchant.trexity.com/
and create an API KEY through your merchant portal.

Feel free to contact support@trexity.com for any questions you may have.

Example:
```
curl -X POST {server-url}/{path} \
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  -H 'Authorization: Bearer <Merchant API Key>' \
  -d '{ ...body... }'
```

addressLine2.description: Second line of the address (apartment, suite, unit, etc.)

provinceCode.description: Province or state code (e.g., ON, BC, CA)

pickupAfter.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

**If present then deliverAfter and deliverBefore are ignored.**

If in the past then defaults to ASAP.
Can be set to `new Date().toISOString()` or `"ASAP"` for ASAP.

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: 2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z

An example: ASAP

deliverAfter.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

If in the past then defaults to ASAP, and must be less than or equal to `deliverBefore` if `deliverBefore` is provided.
Can be set to `new Date().toISOString()` or `"ASAP"` for ASAP.

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: 2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z

An example: ASAP

deliverBefore.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

Cannot be in the past.

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: 2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z

ShipmentRequirements.description:
Object representing the requirements that must be met by a courier in order
for them to be considered eligible for shipment.

If no requirements object is specified then the merchant location's default requirements
will be used.

vehicleType.description:
Describe the type of vehicle that must be used for a shipment.

- any - Any vehicle type is allowed.
- small - Sedan, hatchback, etc [example: Honda Civic]
- medium - SUV or similar [example: Toyota Sienna]

proofOfDelivery.description:
The proof of delivery that must be provided by the courier.

- pin+signature - A PIN exchange and signature given by the recipient are required.
- pin - A PIN exchange given by the recipient is required.
- signature - A signature is required from the recipient.
- photo - A safe-drop with a photo is required.

perishable.description: Must be delivered by a courier who is equipped to deliver perishable items.

returnReusables.description: Must be delivered by a courier who will return collected reusables back to pickup.

ShipmentRateDTO.description: A simple description of a shipment for rating purposes

numLabels.description: The number of labels for the shipment (each separate package needs a label).

name.description: The name of the rate to show to the customer (if applicable)

description.description: The description of the rate to show to the customer (if applicable)

serviceType.description: The shipment service type associated to the shipment rate

fees.description: The breakdown of each fee in the rate.

type.description:
- `delivery` applied for the base delivery fee
- `fuel` applied for fuel surcharge
- `oversized` applied for a surplus of labels
- `distance` applied for long distance deliveries
- `returnable-features` applied for returnable features such bags, or packaging
- `large-vehicle` applied for deliveries that require a medium or large vehicle
- `timewindows-surge` applied for a surcharge fee based on peak time windows

amount.description: The amount in cents of the fee.

subtotal.description: The subtotal in cents before taxes.

rate.description: The tax rate in decimal form (e.g. 0.13 for 13% tax).

totalTaxes.description: The total taxes charged in cents.

total.description: The total price in cents after taxes. (subtotal + totalTaxes)

id.description:
The ID of the shipment rate. This can be used when creating a shipment
to use this exact rate. This rate is only valid until it expires and can only be used once
in a request to create a shipment.

createdAt.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

The date and time when the shipment rate was created.

expiresAt.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

The date and time when the shipment rate will expire.

estimatePickupAt.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: 2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z

estimateDeliverAt.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: 2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z

GeoJSONPosition.description: A single position, represented as [longitude, latitude] or [longitude, latitude, altitude].

GeoJSONLinearRing.description: A closed linear ring, an array of four or more positions where the first and last positions are identical. Represents the boundary of a surface or a hole in a surface.

metadata.description: Object that can contain miscellaneous props, but will always contain "layer"

pickup.description: Geographic areas that merchants can create deliveries for pickup from

delivery.description: Geographic areas that merchants can deliver to according to the standard delivery fees

surcharge.description:
Geographic areas that are considered outside the standard delivery zone and could include a
surcharge fee in addition to the standard delivery fee

SimplifiedDateISOString.description:
Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: `2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z`

status.description:
- `draft`: The shipment is not currently scheduled.
- `pending`: The shipment is scheduled and waiting for courier assignment.
- `assigned`: The shipment is assigned to a courier.
- `in-transit`: The shipment is in transit to the destination address.
- `delivered`: The shipment has been delivered.
- `undeliverable`: The shipment was attempted but could not be delivered, and the shipment was returned.
- `cancelled`: The shipment was cancelled.

PickupStartAt.description:
Specifies the start of the pickup window (i.e. the earliest time that the courier can arrive to pickup).
The second and millsecond time components of the date will be ignored.

When specified, this value must match the start of an available pickup window.

If the shipment is a Direct shipment, then any pickup start time in the future
is available. It will be implied that the pickup window is 2 hours long from the start time.

Review the available [pickup windows](https://trexity.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/16940024932627-Pickup-windows)
for Everyday (default) shipments.

**Data type**

Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: `2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z`

PickupEndAt.description:
Specifies the end of the pickup window (i.e. the latest time that the courier can arrive to pickup).
The second and millsecond time components of the date will be ignored.

When specified, this value must match the end of the available pickup window indicated by the value of `pickupStartAt`.

Review the available [pickup windows](https://trexity.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/16940024932627-Pickup-windows).

**Data type**

Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: `2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z`

DeliverStartAt.description:
The estimated time the delivery work will start. This will always match one
of your suggested [delivery windows](https://merchant.trexity.com/api).

**Data type**

Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: `2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z`

DeliverEndAt.description:
The estimated time the delivery work will end. This will always match one
of your suggested [delivery windows](https://merchant.trexity.com/api).

**Data type**

Date time in Simplified ISO8601 format `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ`

Note that ISO date strings are always in UTC time.

An example: `2020-07-25T10:48:08.987Z`

ShipmentLoad.description:
Optional dimensions and weight of the shipment.

The maximum dimensions are 91 cm for any dimension. The maximum for weight is 15876 grams.

orderId.description: The order ID that this shipment is associated with.

description.description: Description of the contents being delivered

numLabels.description: The number of labels for the shipment (each separate package needs a label).

deliveryValue.description: The dollar value of the shipment in CAD as cents

pickupInstructions.description: Special instructions the courier should follow when picking up the shipment.

deliveryEmail.description: The email address of the recipient

deliveryPhone.description: The cell phone number of the recipient, use a comma (,) to separate the phone number from its extension

giftSenderName.description:
If this shipment is a gift then use this field to set the gift sender's name to show to the recipient instead of "deliveryName".

***If defining a gift, then all gift fields are required, otherwise set gift fields to null or blank.***

giftRecipientName.description:
If this shipment is a gift then use this field to set the gift recipient's name that is receiving the gift.

***If defining a gift, then all gift fields are required, otherwise set gift fields to null or blank.***

giftRecipientEmail.description:
If this shipment is a gift then use this field to set the gift recipient's email that is receiving the gift.

***If defining a gift, then all gift fields are required, otherwise set gift fields to null or blank.***

giftRecipientPhone.description:
If this shipment is a gift then use this field to set the gift recipient's phone number that is receiving the gift, use a comma (,) to separate the phone number from its extension.

***If defining a gift, then all gift fields are required, otherwise set gift fields to null or blank.***

externalId.description:
The ID of the external entity that is associated to
this shipment (e.g. the external order or shipment ID).

scanId.description:
The ID embedded in your custom label's QR code. If
not specified, you will be required to use our built-in labels. If
specified, you will not be able to request our built-in label for this
shipment.

metaField1.description: Optional metadata field to store arbitrary data

metaField2.description: Optional metadata field to store arbitrary data

metaField3.description: Optional metadata field to store arbitrary data

merchantPpid.description: Partner-provided ID of the merchant. This ID can be used when querying for shipments. **Only used by Partner accounts.**

merchantName.description: Partner-provided name of the merchant. This will be displayed in place of the merchant name defined in the merchant profile. **Only used by Partner accounts.**

merchantPhone.description: Partner-provided phone of the merchant. This will be displayed in place of the merchant phone defined in the merchant profile. **Only used by Partner accounts.**

merchantEmail.description: Partner-provided email of the merchant. This will be displayed in place of the merchant email defined in the merchant profile. **Only used by Partner accounts.**

serviceType.description: The service type of the shipment

locationId.description: The ID of the location that the shipment will be associated with for billing purposes.

pickupSequence.description:
If this shipment is part of a batch, then this represents the *estimated* pickup sequence of this shipment depending on courier information,
and/or if shipments have been removed from the batch.

pickupSequenceWhenBatched.description:
If this shipment is part of a batch, then this represents the pickup sequence of this shipment at the time the batch was created.
This is the same sequence number that appears on the label for this shipment and what couriers will ask for at pickup.

locationId.description: The ID of the location that the shipment will be associated with for billing purposes. If not provided, the location will be inferred from the pickup address.

oneOf.description:
The optional service type to use when creating the shipment.
If not provided, the `default` service type will be used.

The optional rate ID to use when creating the shipment. The rate ID must be valid and not expired.
A rate ID can only be used once in a request to create a shipment. The service type will be inferred from the associated rate.

The exact same address information must be provided as the rate was calculated with.

locationId.description: Optionally associate a location, otherwise your default location will be used. This is used for billing purposes. See [Locations](/#tag/Locations) for more information.

pickupInstructions.description: Optional instructions for the courier to pickup the shipment. This will be displayed to the courier in the Courier App.

allOf.description: The effective rate to complete all the orders in the batch

orderIds.description: The IDs of the orders within the batch in the order they will be picked up

id.description: The ID of the batching optimization

orderId.description: The ID of the order this error is associated to

id.description: The ID of the "create shipments" operation

orderId.description: The ID of the order this error is associated to

shipmentIds.description: The IDs of the shipments created

items.description: The ID of the shipment created

province.description: Full province or state name (e.g., Ontario, British Columbia, California)

country.description: Full country name (e.g., Canada, United States)

OperatingHours.description: The operating hours for a location

days.description: The days of the week the location is open

day.description: The day of the week the location is open where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday

ranges.description: The time ranges the location is open on a given day. If empty, the location is closed on this day.

fromTime.description: The time the location is open from in the format HH:MM

toTime.description: The time the location is open to in the format HH:MM

calendarDays.description: Calendar days during the year the location is open. These override any operating hours for days of the week.

day.description: A calendar date in the format MM-DD

ranges.description: The time ranges the location is open on a given calendar day. If empty, the location is closed on this day.

fromTime.description: The time the location is open from in the format HH:MM

toTime.description: The time the location is open to in the format HH:MM

disabledAt.description: The date and time the location was disabled

disabledReason.description: The reason the location is disabled

serviceCity.description: The market name of the city the location operates under

contactEmail.description: The email address of the contact that is used for customer service and notifications

contactName.description: The name of the contact that is used for customer service and notifications

contactPhone.description: The phone number of the contact that is used for customer service and notifications

contactTitle.description: The title of the contact that is used for customer service and notifications

billingContactEmail.description: The email address of the billing contact that is used for billing and invoicing

defaultRequiresPersonHandoff.description: The default `requiresPersonHandoff` setting that will apply to all deliveries associated to this location.

defaultContainsAlcohol.description: The default `containsAlcohol` setting that will apply to all deliveries associated to this location.

defaultDeliveryInstructions.description: The default `deliveryInstructions` that will apply to all deliveries associated to this location.

defaultPickupInstructions.description: The default `pickupInstructions` that will apply to all pickups associated to this location.

lifetimeDeliveryCount.description: The total number of deliveries completed for this location.

lifetimeBatchesCount.description: The total number of batches completed for this location.

lastDeliveredAt.description: The date and time the last delivery was completed for this location.

Receipt.description: A receipt item that is part of a receipt

type.description: The type of the receipt item

locationName.description: The name of the location this receipt item is associated with

locationTimeZone.description: The location time zone IANA identifier

description.description: The invoice number or route ID the receipt item is associated with

orderIds.description: The order IDs associated with the receipt item

cost.description: The cost of the receipt item in cents

additions.description: Array of surcharges and discounts, where discounts will have a negative amount

amount.description: The amount of the addition in cents

subtotal.description: Receipt item subtotal (cost + additions) in cents

totalPaid.description: Receipt item total (subtotal + taxesPaid) in cents
